cyclone.name: CRISTOBAL
cyclone.current_location: about 155 miles west-southwest of Campeche, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Meandering over the southern Bay of Campeche through mid-week, then forecast to lift northward across the central Gulf toward the northern Gulf Coast late this weekend.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana Gulf Coast (near Plaquemines Parish) – still beyond the official 5-day forecast window

weather_observation.watch_coast: None along U.S. coast; current watch area limited to southern Bay of Campeche.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning in effect from Campeche to Puerto de Veracruz, Mexico.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southern Bay of Campeche currently; northern Gulf Coast (including southeast Louisiana) could be affected late in the period.
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force wind probability is very low (3% cumulative in 5 days) but expected to rise if Cristobal accelerates north of the forecast window.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential for minor to moderate surge (>3 ft) along the lower Mississippi Delta late this weekend if the storm tracks toward southeast Louisiana.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands may reach Plaquemines by late Saturday/Sunday with totals that could exceed 4 inches and cause localized flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Increasing seas in approaches to the Mississippi River, possible river mouth restrictions, and reduced visibility in squalls could disrupt vessel traffic ahead of landfall.
